p: It is worth mentioning that only Ma. guianensis EO showed activity against β−lactamase−producing E. coli, with an MIC of 500 µg·mL −1. The composition of this EO is characterized by the presence of sesquiterpenes, with no trace of monoterpenoids, of which 31.32% consist of bicyclogermacrene. This main component was previously reported as active against P. aeruginosa, Acinetobacter baumanii and E. coli [ 36].
